verse:
न जायते म्रियते वा विपश्चिन्नायं कुतश्चिन्न बभूव कश्चित्‌।
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ॥

terms.न जायते म्रियते वा विपश्चिन् na jāyate m: Neither is born, nor does it die, oh wise one
terms.नायं कुतश्चिन्न बभूव कश्चित्‌ nāyaṁ kuta: It does not come from anywhere, nor does it go anywhere
terms.अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो ajo nityaḥ: It is unborn, eternal, and primeval
terms.न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे na hanyate hanya: It is not destroyed when the body is destroyed

meaning: These verses express the fundamental nature of the self or Atman. The self is described as eternal and unchanging, transcending birth and death. It is not subject to any limitations of time or space and exists independent of the physical body. It highlights the indestructible and timeless nature of the self, emphasizing that it cannot be killed or harmed even when the body perishes. This concept is significant in understanding the nature of the individual self and its connection to the eternal consciousness.

upanishad-org.meaning: The Wise One is not born, neither does he die: he came not from anywhere, neither is he any one: he is unborn, he is everlasting, he is ancient and sempiternal: he is not slain in the slaying of the body.
